comments:
I am getting the following exception while checking out some project from cvs. Mylar context is active.

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
	at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:787)
	at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:823)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.toArray(AbstractCollection.java:176)
	at java.util.ArrayList.<init>(ArrayList.java:137)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.core.MylarContext.getInteresting(MylarContext.java:129)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.core.CompositeContext.getInteresting(CompositeContext.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.core.MylarContextManager.getInterestingDocuments(MylarContextManager.java:791)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.core.MylarContextManager.getInterestingDocuments(MylarContextManager.java:809)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.ide.MylarIdePlugin.getInterestingResources(MylarIdePlugin.java:192)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.ide.team.MylarActiveChangeSet.getAllResourcesInChangeContext(MylarActiveChangeSet.java:175)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.ide.team.MylarActiveChangeSet.contains(MylarActiveChangeSet.java:184)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.DiffChangeSet.remove(DiffChangeSet.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.ide.team.MylarActiveChangeSet.remove(MylarActiveChangeSet.java:110)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberChangeSetManager$EventHandler.removeFromAllSets(SubscriberChangeSetManager.java:217)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberChangeSetManager$EventHandler.handleChange(SubscriberChangeSetManager.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberChangeSetManager$EventHandler.doDispatchEvents(SubscriberChangeSetManager.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.dispatchEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:354)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.processEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler$1.run(BackgroundEventHandler.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I'm curious, do you purposely check out projects with a task active?

(In reply to comment #1)
> I'm curious, do you purposely check out projects with a task active?

Not really. It just the way Eclipse allow me to deal with the incoming changes. While I start some tests or wait for something to complete I can review incoming changes from scheduled synchronizations and can pick them up immediately. It doesn't seem interfere with current task activities, so I don't want to deactivate active task.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 133101 ***
